headline: Bernie Sanders compares felons voting to women's suffrage and civil rights movements
subHeadline: Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders doubles down, repeats call for felons to vote from prison; reaction on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everyone. I'm Juan Williams along with Emily Compagno, Jesse Watters, Dana Perino, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, this is “The Five.” Joe Biden is finally in and he's wasting little time going directly after President Trump. He did it during his 2020 announcements.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: We are in the battle for the soul of this nation. I believe history will look back on four years of this president and all he embraces as an aberrant moment in time. But if we give Donald Trump eight years in the White House, he will forever and fundamentally alter the character of this nation.  The core values of this nation, our standing in the world, our very democracy, everything that has made America. America is at stake. That's why today I'm announcing my candidacy for President of the United States.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: President Trump hitting back on twitter saying, quote, welcome to the race Sleepy Joe. I only hope you have the intelligence, long in doubt, to wage a successful primary campaign. It will be nasty. You'll be dealing with people who have truly -- truly have some very sick and demented ideas. But if you make it, I will see you at the starting gate, end quote. And President Obama, he's praising his former VP for jumping into the race, but the former president stopped short of formally endorsing Biden. Biden had to explain why.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I asked President Obama not to endorse. I mean, we should -- whoever wins this nomination should win it on their own merits.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Biden is the Democratic front runner, but critics are saying his past policy positions and his gaffes could hold him back. Take a look at some of them.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: His mom lived in Long Island for ten years or so. God rest her soul, and -- although, she's -- wait, your mom is still -- your mom is still alive. It's your dad passed. God bless her soul. Chuck Graham, state senator is here. Chuck, stand up. Chuck, let them see you. Oh, God love you. What am I talking about?  The man who will be the next President of the United States, Barack America. They're going to put you back in chains.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, Emily, the news doesn't stop. What we saw just as we were coming on the step is an article, I think it was in the Daily Beast, Anita Hill saying that she had a direct conversation with Joe Biden, but his apology is not enough.  He's got to apologize to all the women in America who were affected by the Clarence Thomas, Anita Hill hearings.

utterances.speaker: EMILY COMPAGNO, HOST
utterances.sentences: Sure, that reaction doesn't surprise me at all. I found that video absurd. It was dramatic. It was ridiculous. And the entire thing was man-plaining us. And you guys make fun of me for using big words, and he's -- and cliches within two seconds. This reminded me of a few weeks ago with me and two girls were at the park with our dogs and this guy came strolling out of his big house like literally with his coffee mug because he gets to work from home.  He was like lecturing us about how the park department cares for the grass and we shouldn't have our dogs on it. And I have to force myself to keep watching Biden's video patiently for work because I didn't want to be told by some old crypt keeper. It's not going to bode well. In addition to the out of touch-ness of that video and his stance when people start bringing up things like his authoring of punitive criminal justice bills and laws and whatnot.  When they combine the two and actually point to what he's done, he will go nowhere in these primaries.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana, it's very interesting, the video that Emily is talking about because unlike every other Democrat, he goes directly at President Trump. He says this is really an election for the soul of the nation, there I'm quoting. And says that it's Trump that's the problem, and I guess he's trying to say he's the guy that can beat Trump.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.sentences: Even in the logo, it says Biden, and under it says president, not the Joe part. That's a different logo. But it says Biden and president. So on the one hand, it projects strength where's he's like, I'm not going to worry about this primary. I'm going straight to the general.   I'm going to take him on because that is part of his rationale for running. He's saying I'm the one who can bring this back to the Democrats. I'm the only one that can beat Trump. I'm the one that can win in Pennsylvania, Michigan, Ohio --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: let me interrupt you. Take a look at this Monmouth poll. Right there you see that he is in fact right now beating Trump, 42, 34 --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's pretty early to be saying that. So on the video -- here's what we have to understand, like they have message tested this stuff for a long time. That might not appeal to Republicans or conservatives, but I would imagine that they did a ton of message testing, and it wasn't just instinct for him. Like, they were like figuring out like what exactly -- precisely would works.  The video, I wish that we could have seen is the one that was done by Mark Putnam, but it was -- apparently they threw it out and they didn't want to use it. He does very biographical things if you remember, the fighter pilot from the 2018 midterms. He did those pieces and they're very biographical and little bit younger, I think. That's why I wonder what that video looked like. I don't think it will ever leak out, though.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, we talked about this yesterday that they were shifting and that caused a little dissension among Democrats. You know, hey, things are chaotic over there. What's going on? So, Greg, Sleepy Joe?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: Sleepy Joe, it's not bad. So it's about energy. Jesse was talking about this earlier. He's always -- is able to portray his opposition as having low stamina. But what Biden did was he said that Trump is a threat unlike anything else in his lifetime. I guess it's worse than war, 9/11, disease. I think Kathy Griffin is running his campaign.   But here's why it's bad for my perspective. That wasn't an argument for Biden. That was an argument for anyone but Trump. The argument was orange man evil. It wasn't Joe Biden good. And I don't believe for a second that he talked to Obama, and told Obama don't endorse me. I assume he also told Oprah not to endorse him, Jesus Christ, and the Pope. And he got, actually, Avenatti's endorsement, so that means, maybe, Jussie Smollett will be next? But what's Biden's primary message, everything was great before Trump. I guess that's true with Anita Hill. That was true when he said that Barack Obama was the first mainstream African-American who is articulate, bright, and clean, remember that? So everything was great before Trump, so we need to get rid of Trump and get back to the way things were.  OK, so that's a lie because a lot of stuff sucked back then. The economy, the jobs, military excursion, the spying, Benghazi, remember ISIS? Almost every day we talked about ISIS. North Korea was a threat. We have problems with Russia that were ignored. There was the Ukraine.  So contrary to Joe Biden, America has actually gotten better, stronger. It's more peaceful, more prosperity, safer. The psychological stuff that he's talking about, that's on them. That's a derangement disorder that they haven't gotten over since 2016. So Trump's -- so they don't have anything. They don't have anything except Trump's response to Charlottesville. That's all they have. And his response could have been better, except Biden got it wrong. When he was talking out both sides, he was talking about the monument debate. I have the transcript right here. I can read it for you. When Trump talks about both sides, he was talking about the monument debate. Having said that, Trump could have done a better job at the start. But whenever a big or ugly thing happens like what happened in Charlottesville, there is a fog of war. The first response is always terrible because nobody knows what going on. I can say I never even knew what was going on in Charlottesville that day. I have no idea. If somebody asked me about it, I wouldn't know. I think the first press conference is always the worst.   But he said, he called out the racists, he called out the bigots, and he said that the both sides -- he was talking about the monument debate. It's in the actual transcript. So his whole opening, dark and dishonest.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what? I disagree, but I'm going to stop and go to Jesse. So, Jesse, what we know is that he's going to have a fund-raiser tonight, home of David Cohen, Comcast NBC in Philadelphia. Then on Monday he goes to Pittsburgh to a union hall. By the way, I don't know if you've been booked, but you may get bumpy because Friday he's on The View.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.sentences: One of the better shows on morning television.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So what do you think of the lineup? Is this a good roll out from the leading Democrat?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, he needs money, so that's obviously his main concern. And The View is very friendly territory. And obviously, he needs Pennsylvania. And Allegheny County is a county that Obama performed very well in, so I think he's going back home there. But to the video, I completely agree with Greg. That was not a launch. That was an attack. It was an attack against President Trump's character. He's not running on the economy. He's running on policy. He's seeded policy. He's seeding the great economy to the president. He's going directly after the character of the President of the United States.   And he looks like he's going to make this race about race, about identity, and about hate. And I thought it was small to launch your campaign over something like Charlottesville. I think there are other issues that are much more important to the American people, although I'm not downplaying that.  But this was an ad directed at black America and towards the resistance. That's who he was targeting there. But it was slick and highly produced, but I personally wasn't moved by it. He is an establishment candidate, has never polled over 1 percent. That's why before sleepy, it was 1 percent Joe. And as he gets in the race and starts getting bruised and battered, his numbers will go down. But he has no social media army to back him up. AOC is not enthusiastic about him. And he has no vision that's forward-looking. And to Greg's point, it's about a restoration. Restoring the Obama America to what it was.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Democrats don't do well when they run as restoration candidates. They always do better as change candidates. And again, Trump is the change candidate and that's tough to beat.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: At the moment, he'll be changing from Trump. And I think it is a bifurcation. I think what you're seeing here is he's saying this is about Trump. It's going to be a referendum on Trump. And I'm someone you can trust, and especially on issues about America's soul. And I think, unlike my colleagues here, I think that speaking to Charlottesville speak to grave concerns on the part of the American people about President Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a sensitive patch of recent history and he exploited it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Trump?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. One of President Trump's biggest critics now agreeing that we need to build the wall. Yeah, build the wall, that's coming from a Democrat, next on THE FIVE.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: One of President Trump's biggest critics at the New York Times now saying, president has a point about building a border wall. Watch.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'm as radically pro-immigration as they come, but it's pretty clear to me that unless we can assure a significant number of Americans that we can control our border, were never going to have the proper immigration flow I think we need. I'm for a high wall with a big gate, a compassionate, a smart gate so we can keep immigration going.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Thomas Friedman also saying Trump should use a border crisis to cut a deal on immigration. Now this comes as customs and border protection releases new number showing more migrants were arrested during the first half of this fiscal year that all of fiscal year 2018. Greg, in 2006 I think this was the point that we've made, like we want border security first so that you can have the rest of the things that you need for the economy on immigration.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what it is --what Friedman is doing is -- his reasoning is the wall offers proof of control so you can be confident about the immigration we allow. You know what this reminds me of? It reminds me of criminal background checks. People say, oh, criminal background checks will reduce hiring. No, actually, it just gives you the confidence to hire more. Know that if you give everybody these criminal background checks, you feel pretty safe. So the wall actually increases confidence and healthy immigration. If you want cause and effect, let's not forget that most -- showing up at the border are economic migrants. If you stop that, you create a tight labor market, very boring stuff. But the tight labor market, what does it do? It naturally raises wages. It's what you're seeing among a lot of blue- collar workers.  You're also giving the workers more dollars per hour, but they're also getting more bargaining power because of the tight labor market. They can argue about workplace conditions.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yep. One thing I do admire about him, Jesse, I mean, among other things, his writing is also very good. He went down to the border.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is it really good, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He visited. He didn't just stay in New York or Washington. He actually went there and he says, whoa, OK, I get it. That's what changed his mind.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, when Democrats go down to the border, two things happen. One, it's an Acosta situation when they think they're making a point and they make the exact opposite point. Or someone like Friedman who has his eyes open and he can see the reality. The fact that we're doing a segment on someone in the media saying we do need a wall is a pretty big deal and indicates how crazy the left has become. This was a flare gun that the media shot up so the Democratic Party could say, wait a second, there actually may be a crisis at the border and we may need a message because Trump is going to hurt us in 2020 if we just say we're an open borders party. He's an influencer, Thomas Friedman. Everybody reads him. Everybody respects him. He's an ideas guy. And if the ideas guy agrees with Trump's idea, this must be earth shattering.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yeah. And, Juan -- now it's another flare gun, right? So Thomas Friedman saying to the Democrats you should really come to the table on this. President Trump should cut a deal and we can actually do this because border security has to come first. Do you think any of the Democrats will say he's got a good point there?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Sure. I think most Democrats --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Want a wall first?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Again, you guys have said that, you know, Democrats are pro border security contrary to what Jesse just said about Democrats' open border party.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They are.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- talked about, oh, didn't Clinton, didn't Obama, Pelosi, all voted money for a barrier. Is it just about language --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, once Trump became president then they became open borders.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, because -- and here's my point, so what Tom Friedman is saying is Trump has incited this crisis and it's a shame to waste a crisis when you have an opportunity --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He incited the crisis?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He sure did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So Trump is behind the caravan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Who's been talking about an invasion, Jesse? Who's been talking about -- who's been saying we need to send the military?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Trump's reacting to the crisis, created a crisis?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He wasn't reacting to the current -- the current crisis is a humanitarian crisis of people --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Do you want to know what the real crisis is?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hang on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The real crisis is Congress for not doing anything.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All you do is filibuster and shout. I mean, Greg said we have here a humanitarian crisis. These people are economic refugees seeking asylum legally under our law. We need to deal with it. We need to deal with it in the way Thomas Friedman is suggesting, assure people who think, oh, the borders insecure, so that we can say, hey, we want smart people. We want high-energy people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The frustrating thing about this is it's the same conversation for now, I think, 15 years. And so, what he's also saying is that this haphazard immigration system that we have -- he says it has overwhelmed the border patrol as well as our immigration courts. And so, is there a way to deal with this, Emily? You're a very reasonable person.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: There is if more people see the light that he did. Your boy Tom Friedman said everything right except for I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's not my boy.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Yes, he is. You're speaking so lovingly of him before the show. Because this entire time everyone on the left has dug their trenches for their warfare and refused to take off their goggles of what's actually happening on the border, and have refused to be persuaded or educated by facts or photographs or videos that have been coming from there forever, and the impact on all the different sectors in this country. Instead, refusing to believe or see anything until a physical -- a physical trip actually works. And to speak to your humanitarian crisis aspect, look, you guys read there was a 3-year-old toddler left alone in the desert because everyone's scattered because of the cartel-enforced human smuggling going on. Oh, you think that was a biological family? No, that is a manufactured family when you leave a toddler in the desert because the authorities are coming. So for this not be part of the larger conversation by the left and to have to go there physically just speaks volumes as to what the left has. These goggles over their faces --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think the big goggles here on the right because they don't say, oh, you know what? Trump actually wants to cut legal immigration. Oh, guess what? You know what Tom Friedman said, leave Stephen Miller behind and you can have an honest conversation with people who want to solve this. But if you just keep talking about build a wall --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nobody wants to solve it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: If they come to the table on the wall, the president might actually cut another deal on --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah. In fact, I think he mentioned that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think he already said that, right? All right. We've got to move on. Bernie Sanders not backing down from his controversial push to let felons vote from, underscore, from prison. What he's saying next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Underscore.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Bernie Sanders going all in on his controversial plan to let felons including terrorists like the Boston bomber vote from prison. Bernie now taking it even further with these comparisons.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, I-VT
utterances.sentences: I said that because the right to vote is essential. If you are a citizen, you have the right to vote. And that is a right we must protect because we know the history of this country. We know that women didn't have the right to vote. We know that African- Americans didn't have the right to vote.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Sanders is also slamming a Florida bill requiring felons to pay court fees before becoming eligible to vote as, quote, racist and unconstitutional.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. We just did what -- the frustrating thing was yesterday. Those are two different things. What Bernie Sanders is talking about is people in prison being allowed to vote. The thing in Florida is not good. It is a bill that is passed by the House version, state Senate version is different. It is for people who have gotten out of prison, who have paid their debt to society. They're out of prison. And they're trying to put additional constraints on them. That is a separate topic from what Bernie Sanders is talking about. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So here's my point to you, which is Bernie Sanders is moving this conversation incrementally. You don't want to hear it --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's not true. I'm not going to take a backseat on restoration of felon voting rights. I'm not. I'm talking about from the beginning. Restoring felon voting rights once they get out of prison, yes, I do. But that is not what Bernie Sanders is talking about.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I'm trying to say to you --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- the initial thing the other day. And him moving the conversation incrementally is to try to save face from happening the other day because the entire Democratic Party now is like, whoa, wait, what did he say? I'm going to have to answer that. And I wonder what Joe Biden will say. I bet he'll have a better answer.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think he might have a different answer but I think it's a conversation starter. Boy, everybody is talking about it, Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When Dana gets that mad --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Everybody is talking about it. And you've got to say, you know what, Bernie, you have done something here because lots of people --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Let's give Bernie a round of applause. Let the Boston bomber vote. Good job, Bernie. What a way to start a conversation.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The mayor of Boston is even like what is he talking about? Ab

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Bernie should start more conversations.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I mean, you guys act as if America isn't having this conversation. America --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: America isn't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: America is not having that conversation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: They are having this conversation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I guarantee you there's no family in their table -- you know what? The Boston bomber really should vote in the next election. You know what? I think he could run for president. I think Sornoff would make a great presidential candidate. He could be an aggressive candidate.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You can make a caricature, but the real point --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't have to. You're doing it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No. I think that, in fact, there's an important part to be made about citizenship. And Bernie, like Earl Warren, the former chief justice, all say you don't based citizenship on --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But, Juan --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- or this crime or that crime --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But, Juan, now you're arguing the point. You're arguing the point before. You're trying to switch.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The same point --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Let's argue the point though, Juan. Do you think the Boston bomber should be able to vote in 2020?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Do I think? I haven't considered --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We've been doing this segment for two days.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Because --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Answer the question, yes or no?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think that your citizenship rights are not to be revoked because you don't like me. And if you say --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What if he kill me?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So that's a yes?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Here's the thing --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Could they have a gun in prison too? Because that's a second amendment right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, it's not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a second amendment rights. Maybe he could have a gun. All inmates have guns. Gutfeld 2020.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I just want to say. Look, 22 states right now will restore a felons voting rights after -- for a period after release --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And then you have, in fact, 14 states that say you lose your rights --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, Juan --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Before that.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: All right. We've been talking about this for three days now. As you guys know, I spend a lot of time with inmates and I correspond with them regularly, so I've gotten a lot of emails from them in the last two days. First of all, they watch this show. They're not all flaming liberals --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do they like animals are great?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do they like corny jokes?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Yes, they love you guys.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They shouldn't be watching “The Five.” That's another right. That should be deprived.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, no.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We want them to watch “The Five.”

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We don't need the rating. We're like number one in the country, we don't need inmates.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: They are people too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Prisons.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: They are people too. But here's the point that there is three sections of this conversation. There is the violent terrorists whatever voting from prison. There is the incarcerated non-violent offenders that really this conversation is about. And there is the post-incarceration subject to the fines and everything, which is ridiculous. Yes, secondary imprisonment. And my point in bringing that up is that there is a lot of sentiments that in the non-violent realm, you guys - not everyone in there is like the Grim Reaper.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, we know. Can I respond to you, can I respond to that? I think you're making - you're actually addressing the point that Bernie has screwed up so badly. The problem is there is a perception of the left that they are soft on crime. They're anti-law enforcement. Let's face it. They're anti-cops everything. So, no one takes it seriously when somebody like Bernie Sanders comes out and says that, it fulfills the stereotype. It's a terrible thing to run on, whereas if a Republican came up and said, you know it's time for prison reform and I'm interested in those non- violent offenders having the right to vote. Everybody goes well, it's a Republican. Normally, they're strong on crime. So, maybe I'll listen to him. You see, it's a perception issue.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Can I just add one other thing.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Yes, of course.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, Senators Heitkamp and Donnelly who lost in the midterms. They are Democrats. They are starting a new entity to try to help Democrats talk to people in rural America. Well, guess what, here is your first lesson. What did Mayor Pete say when he was asked on that same night in the CNN town hall? Do you think that felons, is it good to right to vote, while they're incarcerated?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: He said no.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No. That's how you talk to people in America.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: In Indiana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, everywhere for that matter. Except to jail.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everyone. I'm Juan Williams along with Emily Compagno, Jesse Watters, Dana Perino, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, this is “The Five.” Joe Biden is finally in and he's wasting little time going directly after President Trump. He did it during his 2020 announcements.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: We are in the battle for the soul of this nation. I believe history will look back on four years of this president and all he embraces as an aberrant moment in time. But if we give Donald Trump eight years in the White House, he will forever and fundamentally alter the character of this nation. The core values of this nation, our standing in the world, our very democracy, everything that has made America. America is at stake. That's why today I'm announcing my candidacy for President of the United States.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: President Trump hitting back on twitter saying, quote, welcome to the race Sleepy Joe. I only hope you have the intelligence, long in doubt, to wage a successful primary campaign. It will be nasty. You'll be dealing with people who have truly -- truly have some very sick and demented ideas. But if you make it, I will see you at the starting gate, end quote. And President Obama, he's praising his former VP for jumping into the race, but the former president stopped short of formally endorsing Biden. Biden had to explain why.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: I asked President Obama not to endorse. I mean, we should -- whoever wins this nomination should win it on their own merits.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Biden is the Democratic front runner, but critics are saying his past policy positions and his gaffes could hold him back. Take a look at some of them.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: His mom lived in Long Island for ten years or so. God rest her soul, and -- although, she's -- wait, your mom is still -- your mom is still alive. It's your dad passed. God bless her soul. Chuck Graham, state senator is here. Chuck, stand up. Chuck, let them see you. Oh, God love you. What am I talking about? The man who will be the next President of the United States, Barack America. They're going to put you back in chains.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, Emily, the news doesn't stop. What we saw just as we were coming on the step is an article, I think it was in the Daily Beast, Anita Hill saying that she had a direct conversation with Joe Biden, but his apology is not enough. He's got to apologize to all the women in America who were affected by the Clarence Thomas, Anita Hill hearings.

utterances.speaker: EMILY COMPAGNO, HOST
utterances.utterance: Sure, that reaction doesn't surprise me at all. I found that video absurd. It was dramatic. It was ridiculous. And the entire thing was man-plaining us. And you guys make fun of me for using big words, and he's -- and cliches within two seconds. This reminded me of a few weeks ago with me and two girls were at the park with our dogs and this guy came strolling out of his big house like literally with his coffee mug because he gets to work from home. He was like lecturing us about how the park department cares for the grass and we shouldn't have our dogs on it. And I have to force myself to keep watching Biden's video patiently for work because I didn't want to be told by some old crypt keeper. It's not going to bode well. In addition to the out of touch-ness of that video and his stance when people start bringing up things like his authoring of punitive criminal justice bills and laws and whatnot. When they combine the two and actually point to what he's done, he will go nowhere in these primaries.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Dana, it's very interesting, the video that Emily is talking about because unlike every other Democrat, he goes directly at President Trump. He says this is really an election for the soul of the nation, there I'm quoting. And says that it's Trump that's the problem, and I guess he's trying to say he's the guy that can beat Trump.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.utterance: Even in the logo, it says Biden, and under it says president, not the Joe part. That's a different logo. But it says Biden and president. So on the one hand, it projects strength where's he's like, I'm not going to worry about this primary. I'm going straight to the general. I'm going to take him on because that is part of his rationale for running. He's saying I'm the one who can bring this back to the Democrats. I'm the only one that can beat Trump. I'm the one that can win in Pennsylvania, Michigan, Ohio --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: let me interrupt you. Take a look at this Monmouth poll. Right there you see that he is in fact right now beating Trump, 42, 34 --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's pretty early to be saying that. So on the video -- here's what we have to understand, like they have message tested this stuff for a long time. That might not appeal to Republicans or conservatives, but I would imagine that they did a ton of message testing, and it wasn't just instinct for him. Like, they were like figuring out like what exactly -- precisely would works. The video, I wish that we could have seen is the one that was done by Mark Putnam, but it was -- apparently they threw it out and they didn't want to use it. He does very biographical things if you remember, the fighter pilot from the 2018 midterms. He did those pieces and they're very biographical and little bit younger, I think. That's why I wonder what that video looked like. I don't think it will ever leak out, though.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, we talked about this yesterday that they were shifting and that caused a little dissension among Democrats. You know, hey, things are chaotic over there. What's going on? So, Greg, Sleepy Joe?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: Sleepy Joe, it's not bad. So it's about energy. Jesse was talking about this earlier. He's always -- is able to portray his opposition as having low stamina. But what Biden did was he said that Trump is a threat unlike anything else in his lifetime. I guess it's worse than war, 9/11, disease. I think Kathy Griffin is running his campaign. But here's why it's bad for my perspective. That wasn't an argument for Biden. That was an argument for anyone but Trump. The argument was orange man evil. It wasn't Joe Biden good. And I don't believe for a second that he talked to Obama, and told Obama don't endorse me. I assume he also told Oprah not to endorse him, Jesus Christ, and the Pope. And he got, actually, Avenatti's endorsement, so that means, maybe, Jussie Smollett will be next? But what's Biden's primary message, everything was great before Trump. I guess that's true with Anita Hill. That was true when he said that Barack Obama was the first mainstream African-American who is articulate, bright, and clean, remember that? So everything was great before Trump, so we need to get rid of Trump and get back to the way things were. OK, so that's a lie because a lot of stuff sucked back then. The economy, the jobs, military excursion, the spying, Benghazi, remember ISIS? Almost every day we talked about ISIS. North Korea was a threat. We have problems with Russia that were ignored. There was the Ukraine. So contrary to Joe Biden, America has actually gotten better, stronger. It's more peaceful, more prosperity, safer. The psychological stuff that he's talking about, that's on them. That's a derangement disorder that they haven't gotten over since 2016. So Trump's -- so they don't have anything. They don't have anything except Trump's response to Charlottesville. That's all they have. And his response could have been better, except Biden got it wrong. When he was talking out both sides, he was talking about the monument debate. I have the transcript right here. I can read it for you. When Trump talks about both sides, he was talking about the monument debate. Having said that, Trump could have done a better job at the start. But whenever a big or ugly thing happens like what happened in Charlottesville, there is a fog of war. The first response is always terrible because nobody knows what going on. I can say I never even knew what was going on in Charlottesville that day. I have no idea. If somebody asked me about it, I wouldn't know. I think the first press conference is always the worst. But he said, he called out the racists, he called out the bigots, and he said that the both sides -- he was talking about the monument debate. It's in the actual transcript. So his whole opening, dark and dishonest.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what? I disagree, but I'm going to stop and go to Jesse. So, Jesse, what we know is that he's going to have a fund-raiser tonight, home of David Cohen, Comcast NBC in Philadelphia. Then on Monday he goes to Pittsburgh to a union hall. By the way, I don't know if you've been booked, but you may get bumpy because Friday he's on The View.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.utterance: One of the better shows on morning television.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So what do you think of the lineup? Is this a good roll out from the leading Democrat?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, he needs money, so that's obviously his main concern. And The View is very friendly territory. And obviously, he needs Pennsylvania. And Allegheny County is a county that Obama performed very well in, so I think he's going back home there. But to the video, I completely agree with Greg. That was not a launch. That was an attack. It was an attack against President Trump's character. He's not running on the economy. He's running on policy. He's seeded policy. He's seeding the great economy to the president. He's going directly after the character of the President of the United States. And he looks like he's going to make this race about race, about identity, and about hate. And I thought it was small to launch your campaign over something like Charlottesville. I think there are other issues that are much more important to the American people, although I'm not downplaying that. But this was an ad directed at black America and towards the resistance. That's who he was targeting there. But it was slick and highly produced, but I personally wasn't moved by it. He is an establishment candidate, has never polled over 1 percent. That's why before sleepy, it was 1 percent Joe. And as he gets in the race and starts getting bruised and battered, his numbers will go down. But he has no social media army to back him up. AOC is not enthusiastic about him. And he has no vision that's forward-looking. And to Greg's point, it's about a restoration. Restoring the Obama America to what it was.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Democrats don't do well when they run as restoration candidates. They always do better as change candidates. And again, Trump is the change candidate and that's tough to beat.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: At the moment, he'll be changing from Trump. And I think it is a bifurcation. I think what you're seeing here is he's saying this is about Trump. It's going to be a referendum on Trump. And I'm someone you can trust, and especially on issues about America's soul. And I think, unlike my colleagues here, I think that speaking to Charlottesville speak to grave concerns on the part of the American people about President Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a sensitive patch of recent history and he exploited it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Trump?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. One of President Trump's biggest critics now agreeing that we need to build the wall. Yeah, build the wall, that's coming from a Democrat, next on THE FIVE.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: One of President Trump's biggest critics at the New York Times now saying, president has a point about building a border wall. Watch.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I'm as radically pro-immigration as they come, but it's pretty clear to me that unless we can assure a significant number of Americans that we can control our border, were never going to have the proper immigration flow I think we need. I'm for a high wall with a big gate, a compassionate, a smart gate so we can keep immigration going.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Thomas Friedman also saying Trump should use a border crisis to cut a deal on immigration. Now this comes as customs and border protection releases new number showing more migrants were arrested during the first half of this fiscal year that all of fiscal year 2018. Greg, in 2006 I think this was the point that we've made, like we want border security first so that you can have the rest of the things that you need for the economy on immigration.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what it is --what Friedman is doing is -- his reasoning is the wall offers proof of control so you can be confident about the immigration we allow. You know what this reminds me of? It reminds me of criminal background checks. People say, oh, criminal background checks will reduce hiring. No, actually, it just gives you the confidence to hire more. Know that if you give everybody these criminal background checks, you feel pretty safe. So the wall actually increases confidence and healthy immigration. If you want cause and effect, let's not forget that most -- showing up at the border are economic migrants. If you stop that, you create a tight labor market, very boring stuff. But the tight labor market, what does it do? It naturally raises wages. It's what you're seeing among a lot of blue- collar workers. You're also giving the workers more dollars per hour, but they're also getting more bargaining power because of the tight labor market. They can argue about workplace conditions.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yep. One thing I do admire about him, Jesse, I mean, among other things, his writing is also very good. He went down to the border.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is it really good, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He visited. He didn't just stay in New York or Washington. He actually went there and he says, whoa, OK, I get it. That's what changed his mind.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, when Democrats go down to the border, two things happen. One, it's an Acosta situation when they think they're making a point and they make the exact opposite point. Or someone like Friedman who has his eyes open and he can see the reality. The fact that we're doing a segment on someone in the media saying we do need a wall is a pretty big deal and indicates how crazy the left has become. This was a flare gun that the media shot up so the Democratic Party could say, wait a second, there actually may be a crisis at the border and we may need a message because Trump is going to hurt us in 2020 if we just say we're an open borders party. He's an influencer, Thomas Friedman. Everybody reads him. Everybody respects him. He's an ideas guy. And if the ideas guy agrees with Trump's idea, this must be earth shattering.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yeah. And, Juan -- now it's another flare gun, right? So Thomas Friedman saying to the Democrats you should really come to the table on this. President Trump should cut a deal and we can actually do this because border security has to come first. Do you think any of the Democrats will say he's got a good point there?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Sure. I think most Democrats --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Want a wall first?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Again, you guys have said that, you know, Democrats are pro border security contrary to what Jesse just said about Democrats' open border party.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They are.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- talked about, oh, didn't Clinton, didn't Obama, Pelosi, all voted money for a barrier. Is it just about language --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, once Trump became president then they became open borders.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, because -- and here's my point, so what Tom Friedman is saying is Trump has incited this crisis and it's a shame to waste a crisis when you have an opportunity --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He incited the crisis?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He sure did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So Trump is behind the caravan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Who's been talking about an invasion, Jesse? Who's been talking about -- who's been saying we need to send the military?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Trump's reacting to the crisis, created a crisis?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He wasn't reacting to the current -- the current crisis is a humanitarian crisis of people --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do you want to know what the real crisis is?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hang on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The real crisis is Congress for not doing anything.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All you do is filibuster and shout. I mean, Greg said we have here a humanitarian crisis. These people are economic refugees seeking asylum legally under our law. We need to deal with it. We need to deal with it in the way Thomas Friedman is suggesting, assure people who think, oh, the borders insecure, so that we can say, hey, we want smart people. We want high-energy people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The frustrating thing about this is it's the same conversation for now, I think, 15 years. And so, what he's also saying is that this haphazard immigration system that we have -- he says it has overwhelmed the border patrol as well as our immigration courts. And so, is there a way to deal with this, Emily? You're a very reasonable person.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: There is if more people see the light that he did. Your boy Tom Friedman said everything right except for I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's not my boy.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes, he is. You're speaking so lovingly of him before the show. Because this entire time everyone on the left has dug their trenches for their warfare and refused to take off their goggles of what's actually happening on the border, and have refused to be persuaded or educated by facts or photographs or videos that have been coming from there forever, and the impact on all the different sectors in this country. Instead, refusing to believe or see anything until a physical -- a physical trip actually works. And to speak to your humanitarian crisis aspect, look, you guys read there was a 3-year-old toddler left alone in the desert because everyone's scattered because of the cartel-enforced human smuggling going on. Oh, you think that was a biological family? No, that is a manufactured family when you leave a toddler in the desert because the authorities are coming. So for this not be part of the larger conversation by the left and to have to go there physically just speaks volumes as to what the left has. These goggles over their faces --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think the big goggles here on the right because they don't say, oh, you know what? Trump actually wants to cut legal immigration. Oh, guess what? You know what Tom Friedman said, leave Stephen Miller behind and you can have an honest conversation with people who want to solve this. But if you just keep talking about build a wall --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Nobody wants to solve it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: If they come to the table on the wall, the president might actually cut another deal on --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah. In fact, I think he mentioned that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think he already said that, right? All right. We've got to move on. Bernie Sanders not backing down from his controversial push to let felons vote from, underscore, from prison. What he's saying next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Underscore.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Bernie Sanders going all in on his controversial plan to let felons including terrorists like the Boston bomber vote from prison. Bernie now taking it even further with these comparisons.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, I-VT
utterances.utterance: I said that because the right to vote is essential. If you are a citizen, you have the right to vote. And that is a right we must protect because we know the history of this country. We know that women didn't have the right to vote. We know that African- Americans didn't have the right to vote.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Sanders is also slamming a Florida bill requiring felons to pay court fees before becoming eligible to vote as, quote, racist and unconstitutional.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. We just did what -- the frustrating thing was yesterday. Those are two different things. What Bernie Sanders is talking about is people in prison being allowed to vote. The thing in Florida is not good. It is a bill that is passed by the House version, state Senate version is different. It is for people who have gotten out of prison, who have paid their debt to society. They're out of prison. And they're trying to put additional constraints on them. That is a separate topic from what Bernie Sanders is talking about. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So here's my point to you, which is Bernie Sanders is moving this conversation incrementally. You don't want to hear it --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's not true. I'm not going to take a backseat on restoration of felon voting rights. I'm not. I'm talking about from the beginning. Restoring felon voting rights once they get out of prison, yes, I do. But that is not what Bernie Sanders is talking about.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I'm trying to say to you --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- the initial thing the other day. And him moving the conversation incrementally is to try to save face from happening the other day because the entire Democratic Party now is like, whoa, wait, what did he say? I'm going to have to answer that. And I wonder what Joe Biden will say. I bet he'll have a better answer.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think he might have a different answer but I think it's a conversation starter. Boy, everybody is talking about it, Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: When Dana gets that mad --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Everybody is talking about it. And you've got to say, you know what, Bernie, you have done something here because lots of people --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let's give Bernie a round of applause. Let the Boston bomber vote. Good job, Bernie. What a way to start a conversation.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The mayor of Boston is even like what is he talking about? Ab

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Bernie should start more conversations.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I mean, you guys act as if America isn't having this conversation. America --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: America isn't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: America is not having that conversation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They are having this conversation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I guarantee you there's no family in their table -- you know what? The Boston bomber really should vote in the next election. You know what? I think he could run for president. I think Sornoff would make a great presidential candidate. He could be an aggressive candidate.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You can make a caricature, but the real point --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't have to. You're doing it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No. I think that, in fact, there's an important part to be made about citizenship. And Bernie, like Earl Warren, the former chief justice, all say you don't based citizenship on --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But, Juan --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- or this crime or that crime --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But, Juan, now you're arguing the point. You're arguing the point before. You're trying to switch.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The same point --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let's argue the point though, Juan. Do you think the Boston bomber should be able to vote in 2020?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do I think? I haven't considered --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We've been doing this segment for two days.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Answer the question, yes or no?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think that your citizenship rights are not to be revoked because you don't like me. And if you say --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What if he kill me?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So that's a yes?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Here's the thing --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Could they have a gun in prison too? Because that's a second amendment right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, it's not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a second amendment rights. Maybe he could have a gun. All inmates have guns. Gutfeld 2020.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I just want to say. Look, 22 states right now will restore a felons voting rights after -- for a period after release --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And then you have, in fact, 14 states that say you lose your rights --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, Juan --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Before that.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: All right. We've been talking about this for three days now. As you guys know, I spend a lot of time with inmates and I correspond with them regularly, so I've gotten a lot of emails from them in the last two days. First of all, they watch this show. They're not all flaming liberals --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do they like animals are great?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do they like corny jokes?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes, they love you guys.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They shouldn't be watching “The Five.” That's another right. That should be deprived.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, no.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We want them to watch “The Five.”

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We don't need the rating. We're like number one in the country, we don't need inmates.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: They are people too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Prisons.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: They are people too. But here's the point that there is three sections of this conversation. There is the violent terrorists whatever voting from prison. There is the incarcerated non-violent offenders that really this conversation is about. And there is the post-incarceration subject to the fines and everything, which is ridiculous. Yes, secondary imprisonment. And my point in bringing that up is that there is a lot of sentiments that in the non-violent realm, you guys - not everyone in there is like the Grim Reaper.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, we know. Can I respond to you, can I respond to that? I think you're making - you're actually addressing the point that Bernie has screwed up so badly. The problem is there is a perception of the left that they are soft on crime. They're anti-law enforcement. Let's face it. They're anti-cops everything. So, no one takes it seriously when somebody like Bernie Sanders comes out and says that, it fulfills the stereotype. It's a terrible thing to run on, whereas if a Republican came up and said, you know it's time for prison reform and I'm interested in those non- violent offenders having the right to vote. Everybody goes well, it's a Republican. Normally, they're strong on crime. So, maybe I'll listen to him. You see, it's a perception issue.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Can I just add one other thing.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes, of course.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, Senators Heitkamp and Donnelly who lost in the midterms. They are Democrats. They are starting a new entity to try to help Democrats talk to people in rural America. Well, guess what, here is your first lesson. What did Mayor Pete say when he was asked on that same night in the CNN town hall? Do you think that felons, is it good to right to vote, while they're incarcerated?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: He said no.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No. That's how you talk to people in America.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: In Indiana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, everywhere for that matter. Except to jail.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: We have to remain--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Or main in Vermont.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
